013package org.apache.juneau.assertions;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ArgUtils.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.internal.StringUtils.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.assertions.AssertionPredicate.*;
018import java.text.*;
019import java.util.*;
020import java.util.function.*;
021import java.util.regex.*;
022
023import org.apache.juneau.cp.*;
024import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
025
026/**
027 * Predefined {@link AssertionPredicate} objects.
028 *
029 * <p>
030 * Typically used wherever predicates are allowed for testing of {@link Assertion} objects such as...
031 * <ul>
032 *    <li>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#is(Predicate)}
033 *    <li>{@link FluentArrayAssertion#is(Predicate...)}
034 *    <li>{@link FluentPrimitiveArrayAssertion#is(Predicate...)}
035 *    <li>{@link FluentListAssertion#isEach(Predicate...)}
036 * </ul>
037 *
038 * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
039 * <p class='bjava'>
040 *    <jc>// Asserts that a list contains te specified values.</jc>
041 *    List&lt;Object&gt; <jv>myList</jv> = AList.<jsm>of</jsm>(...);
042 *    <jsm>assertList</jsm>(<jv>myList</jv>)
043 *       .is(<jsm>eq</jsm>(<js>"foo"</js>), <jsm>any</jsm>(), <jsm>match</jsm>(<js>"bar*"</js>));
044 * </p>
045 *
046 * <ul class='seealso'>
047 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-assertions.ja.Overview">Overview &gt; juneau-assertions &gt; Overview</a>
048 * </ul>
049 */
050public class AssertionPredicates {
051
052   private static Function<Object,String> TYPENAME = x -> x == null ? null : x.getClass().getName();
053
054   private static final Messages MESSAGES = Messages.of(AssertionPredicates.class, "Messages");
055   private static final String
056      MSG_valueWasNull = MESSAGES.getString("valueWasNull"),
057      MSG_valueWasNotNull = MESSAGES.getString("valueWasNotNull"),
058      MSG_valueDidNotMatchExpected = MESSAGES.getString("valueDidNotMatchExpected"),
059      MSG_valueDidNotContainExpected = MESSAGES.getString("valueDidNotContainExpected"),
060      MSG_valueUnexpectedlyMatched = MESSAGES.getString("valueUnexpectedlyMatched"),
061      MSG_valueWasNotExpectedType = MESSAGES.getString("valueWasNotExpectedType"),
062      MSG_valueDidNotMatchPattern = MESSAGES.getString("valueDidNotMatchPattern");
063
064   /**
065    * Predicate that always returns <jk>true</jk>.
066    *
067    * <p>
068    * Note that this typically has the same affect as a <jk>null</jk> predicate.
069    *
070    * @param <T> The object type being tested.
071    * @return A new predicate.
072    */
073   public static final <T> AssertionPredicate<T> any() {
074      return test(x -> true, null);
075   }
076
077   /**
078    * Predicate that returns <jk>true</jk> if the tested value is not null.
079    *
080    * <p>
081    * Assertion error message is <js>"Value was null."</js>.
082    *
083    * @param <T> The object type being tested.
084    * @return A new predicate.
085    */
086   public static final <T> AssertionPredicate<T> notNull() {
087      return test(x -> x != null, MSG_valueWasNull);
088   }
089
090   /**
091    * Predicate that returns <jk>true</jk> if the tested value is null.
092    *
093    * <p>
094    * Assertion error message is <js>"Value was not null."</js>.
095    *
096    * @param <T> The object type being tested.
097    * @return A new predicate.
098    */
099   public static final <T> AssertionPredicate<T> isNull() {
100      return test(x -> x == null, MSG_valueWasNotNull);
101   }
102
103   /**
104    * Predicate that returns <jk>true</jk> if the tested value equals the specified value.
105    *
106    * <p>
107    * Uses standard Java equality for testing.
108    *
109    * <p>
110    * Assertion error message is <js>"Value did not match expected.  Expected='{0}', Actual='{1}'."</js>.
111    *
112    * @param <T> The object type being tested.
113    * @param value The specified value.
114    * @return A new predicate.
115    */
116   public static final <T> AssertionPredicate<T> eq(Object value) {
117      return test(x -> Objects.equals(x, value), MSG_valueDidNotMatchExpected, value, VALUE);
118   }
119
120   /**
121    * Predicate that returns <jk>true</jk> if the tested value converted to a string matches the specified value.
122    *
123    * <p>
124    * Assertion error message is <js>"Value did not match expected.  Expected='{0}', Actual='{1}'."</js>.
125    *
126    * @param <T> The object type being tested.
127    * @param value The specified value.
128    * @return A new predicate.
129    */
130   public static final <T> AssertionPredicate<T> eq(String value) {
131      return test(x -> Objects.equals(stringify(x), value), MSG_valueDidNotMatchExpected, value, VALUE);
132   }
133
134   /**
135    * Predicate that returns <jk>true</jk> if the tested value does not match the specified value.
136    *
137    * <p>
138    * Assertion error message is <js>"Value unexpectedly matched.  Value='{0}'."</js>.
139    *
140    * @param <T> The object type being tested.
141    * @param value The specified value.
142    * @return A new predicate.
143    */
144   public static final <T> AssertionPredicate<T> ne(Object value) {
145      return test(x -> ! Objects.equals(x, value), MSG_valueUnexpectedlyMatched, VALUE);
146   }
147
148   /**
149    * Predicate that returns <jk>true</jk> if the tested value converted to a string does not match the specified value.
150    *
151    * <p>
152    * Assertion error message is <js>"Value unexpectedly matched.  Value='{0}'."</js>.
153    *
154    * @param <T> The object type being tested.
155    * @param value The specified value.
156    * @return A new predicate.
157    */
158   public static final <T> AssertionPredicate<T> ne(String value) {
159      return test(x -> ! Objects.equals(stringify(x), value), MSG_valueUnexpectedlyMatched, VALUE);
160   }
161
162   /**
163    * Predicate that returns <jk>true</jk> if the tested value converted to a string does not match the specified value ignoring case.
164    *
165    * <p>
166    * Assertion error message is <js>"Value did not match expected.  Expected='{0}', Actual='{1}'."</js>.
167    *
168    * @param <T> The object type being tested.
169    * @param value The specified value.
170    * @return A new predicate.
171    */
172   public static final <T> AssertionPredicate<T> eqic(String value) {
173      return test(x -> StringUtils.eqic(stringify(x), value), MSG_valueDidNotMatchExpected, value, VALUE);
174   }
175
176   /**
177    * Predicate that returns <jk>true</jk> if the tested value converted to a string contains the specified substring.
178    *
179    * <p>
180    * Assertion error message is <js>"Value did not contain expected.  Expected='{0}', Actual='{1}'."</js>.
181    *
182    * @param <T> The object type being tested.
183    * @param value The specified value.
184    * @return A new predicate.
185    */
186   public static final <T> AssertionPredicate<T> contains(String value) {
187      return test(x -> StringUtils.contains(stringify(x), value), MSG_valueDidNotContainExpected, value, VALUE);
188   }
189
190   /**
191    * Predicate that returns <jk>true</jk> if the tested value is the specified or child type.
192    *
193    * <p>
194    * Assertion error message is <js>"Value was not expected type.  Expected='{0}', Actual='{1}'."</js>.
195    *
196    * @param <T> The object type being tested.
197    * @param type The specified type.
198    * @return A new predicate.
199    */
200   public static final <T> AssertionPredicate<T> type(Class<?> type) {
201      assertArgNotNull("type", type);
202      return test(x -> x != null && type.isAssignableFrom(x.getClass()), MSG_valueWasNotExpectedType, type, TYPENAME);
203   }
204
205   /**
206    * Predicate that returns <jk>true</jk> if the tested value is exactly specified type.
207    *
208    * <p>
209    * Assertion error message is <js>"Value was not expected type.  Expected='{0}', Actual='{1}'."</js>.
210    *
211    * @param <T> The object type being tested.
212    * @param type The specified type.
213    * @return A new predicate.
214    */
215   public static final <T> AssertionPredicate<T> exactType(Class<?> type) {
216      assertArgNotNull("type", type);
217      return test(x -> x != null && x.getClass().equals(type), MSG_valueWasNotExpectedType, type, TYPENAME);
218   }
219
220   /**
221    * Predicate that returns <jk>true</jk> if the tested value converted to a string matches the specified match pattern.
222    *
223    * <p>
224    * Match pattern can contain the <js>"*"</js> meta-character.
225    *
226    * <p>
227    * Assertion error message is <js>"Value did not match pattern.  Pattern='{0}', Actual='{1}'."</js>.
228    *
229    * @param <T> The object type being tested.
230    * @param value The specified value.
231    * @return A new predicate.
232    */
233   public static final <T> AssertionPredicate<T> match(String value) {
234      assertArgNotNull("value", value);
235      Pattern p = StringUtils.getMatchPattern(value);
236      return test(x -> x != null && p.matcher(stringify(x)).matches(), MSG_valueDidNotMatchPattern, value, VALUE);
237   }
238
239   /**
240    * Predicate that returns <jk>true</jk> if the tested value converted to a string matches the specified regular expression.
241    *
242    * <p>
243    * Assertion error message is <js>"Value did not match pattern.  Pattern='{0}', Actual='{1}'."</js>.
244    *
245    * @param <T> The object type being tested.
246    * @param expression The regular expression to match.
247    * @return A new predicate.
248    */
249   public static final <T> AssertionPredicate<T> regex(String expression) {
250      assertArgNotNull("expression", expression);
251      Pattern p = Pattern.compile(expression);
252      return test(x -> x != null && p.matcher(stringify(x)).matches(), MSG_valueDidNotMatchPattern, expression, VALUE);
253   }
254
255   /**
256    * Predicate that returns <jk>true</jk> if the tested value converted to a string matches the specified regular expression.
257    *
258    * <p>
259    * Assertion error message is <js>"Value did not match pattern.  Pattern='{0}', Actual='{1}'."</js>.
260    *
261    * @param <T> The object type being tested.
262    * @param expression The regular expression to match.
263    * @param flags Match flags, a bit mask that may include:
264    *    <ul>
265    *       <li>{@link Pattern#CASE_INSENSITIVE CASE_INSENSITIVE}
266    *       <li>{@link Pattern#MULTILINE MULTILINE}
267    *       <li>{@link Pattern#DOTALL DOTALL}
268    *       <li>{@link Pattern#UNICODE_CASE UNICODE_CASE}
269    *       <li>{@link Pattern#CANON_EQ CANON_EQ}
270    *       <li>{@link Pattern#UNIX_LINES UNIX_LINES}
271    *       <li>{@link Pattern#LITERAL LITERAL}
272    *       <li>{@link Pattern#UNICODE_CHARACTER_CLASS UNICODE_CHARACTER_CLASS}
273    *       <li>{@link Pattern#COMMENTS COMMENTS}
274    * @return A new predicate.
275    */
276   public static final <T> AssertionPredicate<T> regex(String expression, int flags) {
277      assertArgNotNull("expression", expression);
278      Pattern p = Pattern.compile(expression, flags);
279      return test(x -> x != null && p.matcher(stringify(x)).matches(), MSG_valueDidNotMatchPattern, expression, VALUE);
280   }
281
282   /**
283    * Predicate that returns <jk>true</jk> if the tested value converted to a string matches the specified regular expression.
284    *
285    * <p>
286    * Assertion error message is <js>"Value did not match pattern.  Pattern='{0}', Actual='{1}'."</js>.
287    *
288    * @param <T> The object type being tested.
289    * @param value The regular expression to match.
290    * @return A new predicate.
291    */
292   public static final <T> AssertionPredicate<T> regex(Pattern value) {
293      assertArgNotNull("value", value);
294      return test(x -> x != null && value.matcher(stringify(x)).matches(), MSG_valueDidNotMatchPattern, value.pattern(), VALUE);
295   }
296
297   /**
298    * Predicate that wraps another predicate.
299    *
300    * <p>
301    * If the predicate extends from {@link AssertionPredicate}, the assertion error
302    * message is <js>"Value did not pass test."</js> followed by the inner assertion error.
303    * Otherwise the message is <js>"Value did not pass test.  Value='{0}'."</js>
304    *
305    * @param <T> The object type being tested.
306    * @param predicate The predicate to run.
307    * @return A new predicate.
308    */
309   public static final <T> AssertionPredicate<T> test(Predicate<T> predicate) {
310      return new AssertionPredicate<>(predicate, null);
311   }
312
313   /**
314    * Predicate that wraps another predicate.
315    *
316    * <p>
317    * If the message specified is <jk>null</jk> and the predicate extends from {@link AssertionPredicate}, the assertion error
318    * message is <js>"Value did not pass test."</js> followed by the inner assertion error.
319    * Otherwise the message is <js>"Value did not pass test.  Value='{0}'."</js>
320    *
321    * @param <T> The object type being tested.
322    * @param predicate The predicate to run.
323    * @param msg
324    *    The error message if predicate fails.
325    *    <br>Supports {@link MessageFormat}-style arguments.
326    * @param args
327    *    Optional message arguments.
328    *    <br>Can contain {@code #VALUE} to specify the value itself as an argument.
329    *    <br>Can contain {@link Function functions} to apply to the tested value.
330    * @return A new predicate.
331    */
332   public static final <T> AssertionPredicate<T> test(Predicate<T> predicate, String msg, Object...args) {
333      return new AssertionPredicate<>(predicate, msg, args);
334   }
335
336   /**
337    * Combines the specified predicates into a singled AND'ed predicate.
338    *
339    * <p>
340    * Assertion error message is <js>"Predicate test #x failed."</js> followed by
341    * the inner failed message if the failed predicate extends from {@link AssertionPredicate}.
342    *
343    * @param <T> The predicate type.
344    * @param predicates The predicates to combine.
345    * @return The combined predicates.
346    */
347   @SafeVarargs
348   public static final <T> AssertionPredicate<T> and(Predicate<T>...predicates) {
349      return new AssertionPredicate.And<>(predicates);
350   }
351
352   /**
353    * Combines the specified predicates into a singled OR'ed predicate.
354    *
355    * <p>
356    * Assertion error message is <js>"No predicate tests passed."</js>.
357    *
358    * @param <T> The predicate type.
359    * @param predicates The predicates to combine.
360    * @return The combined predicates.
361    */
362   @SafeVarargs
363   public static final <T> AssertionPredicate<T> or(Predicate<T>...predicates) {
364      return new AssertionPredicate.Or<>(predicates);
365   }
366
367   /**
368    * Negates the specified predicate.
369    *
370    * <p>
371    * Assertion error message is <js>"Predicate test unexpectedly passed."</js>.
372    *
373    * @param <T> The predicate type.
374    * @param predicate The predicate to negate.
375    * @return The combined predicates.
376    */
377   public static final <T> AssertionPredicate<T> not(Predicate<T> predicate) {
378      return new AssertionPredicate.Not<>(predicate);
379   }
380}
